org.mozilla.browser
Class XPCOMUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.mozilla.browser.XPCOMUtils

public class XPCOMUtils
extends Object

Utilities for creating and accessing of XPCOM components and services.

For understatning what is XPCOM, IDL interfaces, XPCOM objects, services and components, see for example http://www.mozilla.org/projects/xpcom/book/cxc/html/index.html.

Documentation of the XPCOM interfaces available in Mozilla can be found at http://www.xulplanet.com.

Method Detail

proxy

public static <T extends org.mozilla.interfaces.nsISupports> T proxy(org.mozilla.interfaces.nsISupports obj,
                                                                     Class<T> c)
Creates an XPCOM proxy for the given XPCOM object. Methods of the proxy can be then safely called from non-Mozilla threads.

This method creates a synchronous proxy. Therefore, calling a method on the proxy will block the calling thread until the method finishes.

Type Parameters:
T - - an XPCOM interface (org.mozilla.interfaces)
Parameters:
obj - - XPCOM object
c - - interface of the XPCOM proxy to be returned
Returns:
synchronous XPCOM proxy

asyncProxy

public static <T extends org.mozilla.interfaces.nsISupports> T asyncProxy(org.mozilla.interfaces.nsISupports obj,
                                                                          Class<T> c)
Creates an XPCOM proxy for the given XPCOM object. Methods of the proxy can be then safely called from non-Mozilla threads.

This method creates an asynchronous proxy. Therefore, a call of a method on the proxy will return immediately. The body of the method will be executed later on the Mozilla thread.

Type Parameters:
T - - an XPCOM interface (org.mozilla.interfaces)
Parameters:
obj - - XPCOM object
c - - interface of the XPCOM proxy to be returned
Returns:
asynchronous XPCOM proxy

create

public static <T extends org.mozilla.interfaces.nsISupports> T create(String contractID,
                                                                      Class<T> c)
Creates a new XPCOM object with the given contract ID. This method is an equivalent of the do_CreateInstance() macro in mozilla source code. For example, 
   create("@mozilla.org/timer;1", nsITimer.class)
creates a new XPCOM timer object and returns its nsITimer interface. Similarly, 
   create("@mozilla.org/timer;1", nsISupports.class)
creates an XPCOM timer object and returns its nsISuppors interface.

Type Parameters:
T - - an XPCOM interface (org.mozilla.interfaces)
Parameters:
contractID - - identifier of the XPCOM object to create
c - - interface of the new XPCOM object to be returned
Returns:
newly created XPCOM object

createProxy

public static <T extends org.mozilla.interfaces.nsISupports> T createProxy(String contractID,
                                                                           Class<T> c)
Creates a new XPCOM object with the given contract ID. See create() for more details.

Moreover, this method can be called from non-Mozilla threads and returns a proxy of the XPCOM object. Methods of the proxy can be then safely called from non-Mozilla threads.

Type Parameters:
T - - an XPCOM interface (org.mozilla.interfaces)
Parameters:
contractID - - identifier of the XPCOM object to create
c - - interface of the new XPCOM object to be returned
Returns:
proxy of newly created XPCOM object

getService

public static <T extends org.mozilla.interfaces.nsISupports> T getService(String contractID,
                                                                          Class<T> c)
Returns XPCOM service with the given contract ID. This method is an equivalent of the do_GetService() macro in mozilla source code. For example, 
   getService("@mozilla.org/cookiemanager;1", nsICookieManager.class)
returns the nsICookieManager interface of the Mozilla's cookie service. Similarly, 
   getService("@mozilla.org/cookiemanager;1", nsICookieService.class)
returns the nsICookieService interface of the cookie service.

Type Parameters:
T - - an XPCOM interface (org.mozilla.interfaces)
Parameters:
contractID - - identifier of the XPCOM service
c - - interface of the XPCOM service to be returned
Returns:
XPCOM service

getServiceProxy

public static <T extends org.mozilla.interfaces.nsISupports> T getServiceProxy(String contractID,
                                                                               Class<T> c)
Returns XPCOM service with the given contract ID. See getService for more details.

Moreover, this method can be called from non-Mozilla threads and returns a proxy of the XPCOM service. Methods of the proxy can be then safely called from non-Mozilla threads.

Type Parameters:
T - - an XPCOM interface (org.mozilla.interfaces)
Parameters:
contractID - - identifier of the XPCOM service
c - - interface of the XPCOM service to be returned
Returns:
proxy of XPCOM service

qi

public static <T extends org.mozilla.interfaces.nsISupports> T qi(org.mozilla.interfaces.nsISupports obj,
                                                                  Class<T> c)
Returns a different interface of the given XPCOM object. This method is an equivalent of the do_QueryInterface() macro in mozilla source code.

For example, the Mozilla's cookie service implements the following interfaces 

   nsICookieService
   nsICookieManager
   nsICookieManager2
   nsIObserver
   nsISupportsWeakReference
Obtaining another interfaces of an XPCOM object is done using the following code snippet 
   nsICookieManager cm = ....
   nsIObserver os = qi(cm, nsIObserver.class);

Type Parameters:
T - - an XPCOM interface (org.mozilla.interfaces)
Parameters:
obj - - an XPCOM object
c - - interface of the XPCOM object to be returned
Returns:
XPCOM object

register

public static void register(String contractID,
                            org.mozilla.interfaces.nsIFactory factory)
Registers a new factory for the XPCOM objects and services.

For example, this code registers a new factory for the timer XPCOM object. 

   nsIFactory myTimerFactory = ...
   register("@mozilla.org/timer;1", myTimerFactory);

Note, some XPCOM objects (such as XPCOM services) are singletons. Therefore, if a custom factory is registered when the singleton already exists, the method createInstance() of the factory will be never called.

Parameters:
contractID - - identifier of the XPCOM objects this factory creates
factory - - factory for XPCOM objects
